attributes.action: Refuse entry to the refugees currently held up in Calais camps when they close
attributes.background:
There are currently over 5000 refugees camping at Calais. Natacha Bouchart plans to demolish these camps and send these people to the UK. She says this will happen "very soon". 
Our country is not capable of such numbers nor are we a soft touch.
This is not our problem.
attributes.additional_details:
Read the story here about the impending demolishing of the camps. 
http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/calais-mayor-says-brexit-means-8408236?utm_content=buffercbf60&utm_medium=social&utm_source=facebook.com&utm_campaign=buffer

attributes.action: Do Not Grant An Amnesty To allow illegal immigrants to remain after Brexit
attributes.background:
There is a petition active calling for an amnesty which will allow illegal immigrants to remain in the UK after Brexit. 
This shouldn't happen. They are here illegally and should be treated as such

attributes.action: Exempt under 18's from paying adult fares on public transport
attributes.background:
As a 17 year old user of public transport, I find it unfair that I have should have to pay adult fares when I am not considered an adult in any other part of society eg.I can't vote, earn the minimum adult wage or buy alcohol. 
Please support my campaign for reduced fares for under 18's

attributes.action: Stop the Closure of Minor Injuries Units in Ely, Doddington and Wisbech
attributes.background: Cambridgeshire & Peterborough Clinical Commissioning Group want to close our essential minor injuries units and we, the undersigned, are petitioning the government to keep these invaluable units open in areas where they are needed the most

attributes.action: Pay £350m per week to NHS or re-run EU Referendum
attributes.background: The only slogan on the side of the Leave EU campaign bus stated in large letters that if we left the EU, £350m per week could go to the NHS. The government has now stated that this will not happen so the reason thousands voted for Brexit and the democratic will of the people has been ignored.
attributes.additional_details: The UK electorate was also led to believe that continued access to the EU single market would be likely if we voted to leave the EU. Many people believed this but the government has stated it will not be seeking to remain in the single market. There is clear evidence of dissatisfaction with the presentation of information from both sides prior to the referendum and subsequently numerous leave voters have expressed regret that they believed the misinformation upon which they based their decision.

attributes.action: Reassess general aviation airfields as green belt not brown field sites.
attributes.background: Airfields around the country are categorised  as brown field sites making them attractive for development of housing estates. However these airfields are 90% grass land. Reassessing them as green belt will protect our green countryside, protect local employment and protect general aviation.
attributes.additional_details: General Aviation airfields are home to wild flowers, plants and grasses as well as many small animals and birds. Our future commercial pilots start their training at these airfields which provide local employment. We will miss this national resource when it's too late and they have been dug up for housing. These are green sites and must be afforded the same protection as farm land.

attributes.action: Suspend all trials of graded exercise therapy in children and adults with ME/CFS
attributes.background: In surveys hundreds of patients have reported harm — some becoming housebound or bedbound, indefinitely — from graded exercise therapy (GET). The Government must demand that research and funding bodies suspend all trials of graded exercise therapy for ME/CFS until the evidence has been reassessed.
attributes.additional_details: Clinical trials such as MAGENTA still use graded exercise therapy, even in children, but are being justified on the basis of the flawed PACE trial. Scientists have severely criticised PACE, the major adult trial that claimed the therapy to be safe and effective. Thousands have demanded retraction of PACE’s “misleading” analyses and 24 ME/CFS charities from 14 countries demanded that its data be released for reanalysis. PACE is no basis for a trial in children or adults. Read more at stopGET.org

attributes.action: Devolve the power to allow medicinal use of cannabis to the Scottish Parliament
attributes.background:
The UK Government controls drugs policy and has no plans to allow the medicinal use of cannabis.

The Scottish Government want to consider reforming laws to allow the medicinal use of cannabis.

This petition calls for the UK Government to give the required power to the Scottish Government.
attributes.additional_details:
Many jurisdictions already allow the medical use of cannabis for conditions such as MS, arthritis and others. A cross party group of MPs has also called for the UK to follow suit.

http://www.thetimes.co.uk/edition/scotland/sturgeon-seeks-right-to-legalise-medical-cannabis-376m6mp7n

http://www.heraldscotland.com/news/14791145.Nicola_Sturgeon_faces_calls_to_back_cannabis_for_medicinal_use_/

https://www.theguardian.com/science/2016/sep/13/all-party-group-legalisation-cannabis-medicinal-uses

attributes.action: Prevent the new HS2 proposed line passing through Bramley, Rotherham
attributes.background: HS2 are proposing a new route for the line to pass through the village of Bramley. This means it will be dangerously close to local housing and other ameneties which raises a number of concerns including:- safety of local children, noise polution, negative impact on house prices, to name (but) a few

attributes.action: Yorkshire Against HS2 Petition: Cancel HS2 or Change route Mexborough-Crofton
attributes.background: We believe that the proposed route announced on July 7th of the HS2 Train Route & Works (including RSM Depot in New Crofton) through our communities in West and South Yorkshire is a disgrace
attributes.additional_details:
HS2 will destroy hundreds of homes,damage our communities,& wreck the environment in Crofton, Altofts, Sharlston, Hemsworth,South Kirkby & Mexborough.We oppose the current routes and the cost of HS2.We demand the cancellation of the project or require the changing of the plans for viable alternative routes which have been proposed & which HS2 has failed in its statutory duty to consider.

www.croftonagainsths2.yolasite.com

attributes.action: Make it illegal to not wear a helmet when riding any bike, skateboard or scooter
attributes.background: Georgia Fairthorne fell off a skateboard without a helmet on and is now critical in intensive care. Not wearing a helmet could be a life or death choice. It is already illegal in some countries and should be made illegal in the United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Help Save Children with Neuroblastoma
attributes.background:
Children with Neuroblastoma face many months of intense treatment but the chances of relapse are high. There is treatment in the USA that reduces this risk but that has to be funded privately.
The amount of money that is needed to pay for this runs in to hundreds of thousands of pounds.
attributes.additional_details: There have been a number of recent cases in the media where families of children with this cancer were trying to raise £550,000 to get this treatment in America. If the treatment is available to reduce the risk we should be providing that treatment here in the UK.

attributes.action: I would like to see the introduction of safe standing at football matches.
attributes.background: I, and many other football fans across the country, believe that the reintroduction of safe standing will produce an enhanced atmosphere at football games. It's been done successfully abroad, notably Germany, for many years. It's time we brought it back!

attributes.action: Make smoking in and near children's parks and playgrounds against the law.
attributes.background: Yesterday a woman asked if it would bother me if she smoked in the playground while on the seesaw with her young daughter.  When I said it would bother me, she told me that my one year old son would turn out to be "arrogant" and smoked anyway.  Secondhand smoke, even outside, is dangerous for kids.
attributes.additional_details: Secondhand smoke has around 4000 chemicals, 50 of which cause cancer, and many others which are very dangerous, especially for children and pregnant women.  Thirdhand smoke is the smoke that is leftover as residue on surfaces.  If, for example, someone is smoking on a seesaw, the dangerous chemicals from that smoke will then be touched and possibly ingested by the children who will next use that playground equipment. Dogs are banned from kids' parks. Smoke should also be banned in and near them.

attributes.action: Scrap the  Driver CPC
attributes.background: I'm a HGV DRIVER and a lot of my fellow drivers think that the CPC (Certificate of Professional Competence) is a waste of time and just a money making exercise for the government.
attributes.additional_details: We as a whole are professional drivers and although we all can learn new things the course is a complete waste of time and want it scrapped.

attributes.action: Shift Agricultural Subsidies to Support Environmental Protections post-Brexit.
attributes.background:
The government should redirect subsidies in a post-Brexit domestic agricultural policy, away from environmentally damaging farming, and towards environmental protections. 

Subsidies are needed to support farmers who tackle climate change, mitigate floods, increase biodiversity and soil health.
attributes.additional_details:
The public are understandably discouraged with the current formulation of the Common Agricultural Policy. They don’t want to see their taxes being used to line the pockets of already wealthy landowners, or to prop up failing farming industries unconditionally.

The public wants to see a domestic agricultural policy that is ahead of the curve by leading us on the path towards a low-carbon farming future, where our agricultural system provides significant benefits to the environment.

attributes.action: Recognise Brexit is too costly, cancel and prioritise spending on the NHS
attributes.background: The costs of Brexit will be enormous - a shrunken economy wiping out any savings from leaving the EU with no guarantee after years of tough  and costly renegotiation we will achieve better trade treaties. Accept this now by cancelling Brexit in order to concentrate on saving the NHS and our schools.
attributes.additional_details: The costs of Brexit are increasing day by day. Thousands of expensive civil servants will be needed to renegotiate forty years of EU legislation and treaties with no guarantee that there will be improvement for any section of the population. Millions of EU and UK citizens abroad are living in uncertainty as to their futures while attention and resources are diverted from solving the crises in education and the NHS. Cancel Brexit and divert the resources saved to the NHS and our schools.

attributes.action: Hallmarks by assay offices located overseas should not be identical to UK marks.
attributes.background: In 2013 the 4 UK Assay Offices were allowed to open up sub-offices in other countries. The intention was that 'offshore' assayed items would carry a different hallmark. Birmingham Assay Office in Mumbai, India are using Birmingham hallmarks identical to the UK marks. This misleads the consumer.

attributes.action: Ensure a new hospital is built central to all West Hertfordshire communities
attributes.background:
It must be purpose-built and equipped to modern standards with enough space for parking and future expansion.

We are members of the New Hospital Campaign formed to request a new hospital on a central, accessible site between the three main towns - Hemel Hempstead, St. Albans and Watford.
attributes.additional_details:
The local NHS is proposing to keep the Watford site in Vicarage Road as the acute hospital. This plan is not sustainable: it cannot meet the health needs of the people of the area. The estate requires £100m of backlog maintenance and cannot be brought up to modern standards. 

We need a new hospital that everyone can get to, which surveys have repeatedly shown patients want. The present hospital is in a congested corner of our area, next to the ground of a Premier League football club.

attributes.action: Create a new cabinet post  'Animal Welfare Secretary'
attributes.background: The general public and a growing number of MPs want to see vast improvement in the welfare of domestic, farm and wild animals in the UK and for animals to have a compassionate voice in parliament.
attributes.additional_details: Responsibilities could include the desire to 'end long distance live animal exports', 'end caged hens and farrowing crates for pigs', 'introduce better meat labelling', 'have CCTV in all slaughterhouses', 'phase out non stun slaughter', 'have scientific evidence-based debate on badger culling and driven grouse shooting', 'strengthen the ban on hunting with hounds', 'prevent dog fighting and badger baiting and ensure higher prison sentences for perpetrators', 'ban indiscriminate snares' etc.

attributes.action: STOP all immigration & implement an Aussie style border control system.
attributes.background: We the British public would like to see an immediate STOP on all immigration and see the implementation of a border control system for all future immigration.
attributes.additional_details: We need an Aussie style border control system, where people trying to come into the Country are checked for full documentation, passport, birth certificate, working visa’s, health insurances etc, proof of an address where they will live, proof of an employment contract, educational & professional qualifications, an adequate amount of money to live on until they are paid from their employment. Failure to supply ALL of this information should find an individual with refusal of entry.

attributes.action: Keep the EU's environmental protection laws for the UK.
attributes.background:
“One just hopes that collaboration on these issues, conservation issues, will transcend political divisions” Sir David Attenborough 

A call for us to set aside our differences and secure a safe future for the environment as a nation.
attributes.additional_details:
'The EU’s record on environmental issues is arguably one of its greatest achievements. It has developed world-leading legislation on a range of issues, which have helped tackle water and air pollution, protected endangered species, and imposed tough safeguards on the use of genetically modified crops and potentially dangerous chemicals.' The Independent

Regardless of your opinions on Brexit, let us unite to secure a safe future for the environment as an independent nation.

attributes.action: Training Paediatric Medical Professionals in Diagnosing Craniosynostosis
attributes.background: Craniosynostosis is a skull condition that causes a baby to be born with, or develop an abnormally shaped head. The irregular skull shape causes severe symptoms resulting from increased pressure in the skull, it affects 1 in every 3,000 babies born each year but is a largely unheard of condition.
attributes.additional_details: Lucy's Head Start is campaigning for mandatory training for paediatric medical professionals leading to earlier diagnosis.Families involved with Lucy's Head Start have reported that some but not all midwives, health vistors or GPs have dismissed, missed, misdiagnosed or mistaken their child's condition for flat head due to lack of awareness, which is why we desperately need mandatory training.Most children diagnosed require surgery and early intervention is vital to prevent severe symptoms.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for all animal skins and furs to be imported and sold in the UK
attributes.background:
Each year 50 million animals are violently killed for use in the fashion industry. They are beaten, electrocuted and skinned alive for their skins and furs. 

The fur and skin industry is outdated, cruel and unnecessary. It must be consigned to history.
attributes.additional_details:
Cruelty Assured: http://features.peta.org.uk/origin-assured-fur/

9 Shocking Fur facts: http://www.peta.org/features/nine-shocking-fur-facts/

Fur Facts: http://www.bornfreeusa.org/facts.php?p=452&more=1

attributes.action: Enable police to chase motorcycle thieves not wearing a crash helmet
attributes.background:
At present police,are not allowed to chase a motorcycle thief who is not wearing a crash helmet.
This law has seen a high rise in motorcycle theft.
Without a change in the law this epidemic will continue to grow

attributes.action: Make breastfeeding education an integrated part of PSHE curriculum in schools
attributes.background: Early education on breastfeeding  can improve the general health of society, reducing the risks of obesity, infection, cancer, osteoporosis and postnatal depression rates, by increasing the likeliness of successful breastfeeding for mothers in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
http://m.unicef.org.uk/Media-centre/Press-releases-archive/Breastfeeding-could-save-the-NHS-millions-says-new-report/


http://www.cam.ac.uk/research/news/breastfeeding-linked-to-lower-risk-of-postnatal-depression

attributes.action: We the people of Great Britain will not advocate war against Russia regardless .
attributes.background: The movement of troops and growing provocation towards Russia has not been and will not be advocated by the British people, we will not stand by and watch another senseless war with countless deaths. President Obama and his administration have an agenda, WE, the people of Great Britain do not .
attributes.additional_details:
Time and again, it has been proved that media is manipulated by government for its own gains, WE, the people of Great Britain will no longer listen to your propaganda, who knows what you greedy suits want. WE the people of Great Britain can not emphasize how important it is for you to listen to us now, DO NOT FOLLOW AMERICA TO WAR, YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED, DEMOCRACY MEANS YOU DO AS WE SAY, WE ARE WATCHING YOU, CROSS US AT YOUR PERIL. 


http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-36575180

attributes.action: Free British citizenship for all commonwealth soldiers and veterans
attributes.background: I am a South African, living in the uk, and think it's a disgrace, that I have to pay my way to get British citizenship. I have fought for the queen in Afghanistan yet I have to now pay, to live in the county I fought for!
attributes.additional_details: The fee for a settlement application within the UK will increase to £1,875. British citizen naturalisation fees for adults will increase to £1,156 and child registration fees to £936, which also represent 25% increases.2 Mar 2016

attributes.action: Mandatory course/examination on food & drink for allergies & intolerances
attributes.background: My wife recently found out she was a Coeliac and I am allergic to nuts, as a chef I can’t believe the amount of chefs and catering staff that have no idea what these intolerance, allergies and illnesses are and how they can affect people.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe that many of the trained and un-trained catering employees don’t have training on intolerances, allergies and food based illnesses, with more and more people suffering from nut allergies, Coeliac disease, lactose intolerance, as well as the other food based allergies such as egg, soya, seafood, this issue must be dealt with before anyone else dies or becomes extremely ill.
The death of Paul Wilson who suffered a severe anaphylactic shock after ordering a meal from an Indian take away,

attributes.action: Provide much needed Truck Stops across the UK with modern facilities.
attributes.background: The Haulage Industry carries valuable cargo. The UK in general needs more dedicated Truck Stops with advanced facilities e.g CCTV, shower blocks, healthy food outlets.Laybys have no facilities and are a last resort. Without HGV's our shops would be empty. Drivers deserve a safe secure resting place.
attributes.additional_details: Already there is inadequate space for HGV's to park up on their rest times.With the volume of vehicles forever increasing on all roads across the UK, this situation will only get worse.Many HGV drivers experience theft of cargo and fuel, even at well known Service Stations.Current services have not grown with the increase of freight on the road, and often have very poor and neglected facilities.Truck drivers are on the road for many days at a time ,they deserve to have decent working facilities.

attributes.action: implement a Law that would ban all hydraulic fracturing (fracking) for 20 years
attributes.background: fracking is still in the early stages of development compared with other mining methods but seems to already be implicated in various environmental problems, a Law that would ban all hydraulic fracturing for a minimum of 20 years will give time to show the long term implications for the environment

attributes.action: Allow subsidised MoD flights for family members to visit Falklands War Graves.
attributes.background: Widows and parents of British servicemen killed in the Falklands are required to pay the full fare of £2,200 to take chartered flights to visit their loved ones’ graves. This petition requests that the MoD allow family members full access to subsidised travel for the purpose of visiting war graves.

attributes.action: Introduce 'Emily's Law' to ensure health and safety on privately-owned boats
attributes.background: 15 year old Emily Gardner from Gloucestershire died when her friend's boat capsized at sea. A catalogue of errors led to her death including the fact she was wearing a damaged and ill-fitting buoyancy aid. No laws currently exist to ensure that health and safety is observed on leisure craft.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/tearful-mum-watches-schoolgirls-lifeless-8088025

https://assets.digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk/media/5614f0fce5274a6251000003/MAIBInvReport21_2015.pdf

attributes.action: Stop the SIA charging £220 for officers to renew their licence.
attributes.background: Why should the Security Industry Authority charge people every three years £220 to renew their licence and an additional £110 for any other licences held. People should not have to pay this amount of money to be able to go to work.
attributes.additional_details:
The security profession is overlooked by this country and most employees are on minimum wage.
We should not have to pay to work, the government should fund this organisation and not the employees. 
Without security officers the country would be nowhere near as safe as it is and we should be treated fairly.
This charge is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Make UK political advertising subject to the Advertising Code.
attributes.background: Political campaigning is a form of advertising, and like all other forms of advertising, it should be regulated. The recent referendum campaign highlights the urgent need for political advertising to become subject to the Advertising Code in the same way as other areas of advertising and marketing.
attributes.additional_details:
The Advertising Standards Authority ensures all adverts in the UK are "legal, decent, honest and truthful", and has the power to ban false advertising. However, their powers do not currently extend to political campaigning, meaning we have more protection when buying a toaster than voting in a referendum. 

An extension of the ASA's powers would strengthen our democratic system and protect free speech. Let's remove lies from our political discourse, and kick "post-truth politics" out of Britain.

attributes.action: Stop all refugees to the UK.
attributes.background: This only encourages more to come, we already have enough issues with looking after our own people.  Help should be focused in the closest safe country.

attributes.action: Revise the child allowance and maternity pay for multiple birth families
attributes.background:
Currently there is no extra maternity pay for multiple birth parents despite the cost being greater.  
The child allowance doesn't assist either having the second child at a reduced rate.
Both of these should be revised to help parents who are already over worked by a multiple birth.
attributes.additional_details:
The stat maternity pay at the moment is currently between £500-£600 a month which for a single parent is a large drop in salary, but doubled costs (or greater) for twice as many nappies, formula, clothes etc. means that this money is not sufficient for the needs of the family. 
The first child receives standard child benefit, the second however is treated as if they were not born at the same time. 
Multiple births are natural but parents aren't helped with that burden.

attributes.action: EXEMPT SUPPORTED HOUSING FROM HOUSING BENEFIT CAP
attributes.background: Proposals to cap housing benefit for supported housing jeopardises the future of this essential accommodation, which provides a home for the country’s most vulnerable citizens.
attributes.additional_details:
The people affected include
•         frail elderly people
•         young people leaving care
•         women fleeing domestic violence
•         people recovering from alcohol and substance misuse
•         people with mental health issues
•         people with physical and/or learning disabilities
•         former military servicemen and women 

We the undersigned therefore call upon HM Government to exempt supported housing from any cap on housing benefit

attributes.action: Stop vaccination with the Influenza Nasal Spray Vaccine in our schools.
attributes.background: There is parental concern about the use of the Influenza Nasal Spray Vaccine in schools. There may be a risk of inhalation of the GM viral particles to those not consenting and evidence shows that recently vaccinated children may transmit the vaccine influenza strain to others in their community.
attributes.additional_details: If it is true that non consenting children are exposed to the GM viral particles or to the vaccine strains of influenza in school, the Nasal Spray Flu Vaccine Programme would appear to directly contradict the Secretary of State’s declaration in The Health Protection (Vaccination) Regulations 2009. This states that 'there is no provision for imposing or enabling any restriction or requirement which has, or would have, a significant effect on a person’s rights'.

attributes.action: New Autism training for teachers to be designed and led by Autistic people.
attributes.background: It's been recently announced that teachers will have to learn about how they can support their students with Autism. I think that the material and delivery should be designed by people on the Autistic Spectrum. To help give staff a greater insight into the way we think.

attributes.action: Make it law to sell and use only silent fireworks
attributes.background: Firework bangs terrify pets, farm animals, wildlife and young children. For hours on firework night, the weeks before and after and at dozens of other events all year.  The British Fireworks Association says restricting sale and use would increase illegal activity. Silent fireworks are a compromise.
attributes.additional_details:
In  parts of Europe silent fireworks are used increasinlgy to protect pets, livestock and wildlife.  Collecchio, Italy, passed a law in 2015 that all fireworks displays must be quiet.
 The World Health Organization lists 120 decibels as the pain threshold for sound, including sharp sounds such as thunderclaps. Fireworks are louder than that and can lead to hearing loss..
Animals fleeing from fireworks often get lost, injured or killed. Noisy fireworks are not as colourful as silent ones.

attributes.action: Cut Foreign Aid to help fund Social Care instead of increasing Council Tax
attributes.background: The Government are seeking to increase Council Tax as a way of funding the gap in Social Care Funding. We believe that instead of further taxing already struggling families the foreign aid budget should be cut and the money saved to be used instead.
attributes.additional_details: In her maiden speech the Prime Minister stated she would be working for all those people who were just about managing. Let her prove it by listening to the people.

attributes.action: Regulate Isle of Wight ferry prices
attributes.background: I personally want to travel to Portsmouth to see my daughter but i have to go via Southampton as i am priced out by Wightlink due to their excessive fees. The IOW residents especially need regulation to stop the companies from monopolising on the services they provide. This is one of many examples.
attributes.additional_details: Both Isle of Wight ferry companies (Red Funnel and Wightlink) are charging a lot of money to travel, especially when there is events on the Island.  This restricts people financially (especially residents as they have no choice in using these two companies) in travelling either from or to the isle of wight.  This is damaging businesses on the Island that rely on tourist trade which is in decline,  families are also restricted in seeing each other.

attributes.action: British farmers should legally have to be paid at least the cost of production.
attributes.background: Farming is one of the only industries in which businesses are paid less than the cost of production. Take the dairy industry for example; the cost of producing a pint of milk is between 25 - 33.5 pence per litre (1), yet the majority of British farmers are paid under 20 pence per litre (2
attributes.additional_details:
Continuing to use dairy as an example, since 2000, more than half of British dairy farms have closed down, reducing from over 28,000 to under 10,000 (3), and this trend shows no signs of slowing down. 'Nearly one in 10 dairy farms across England and Wales have closed in the last three years' (4).

But this doesn't just affect dairy farmers, there are forecasts that the income for many others are due to drop by the following amounts this year alone (5):
Cereals down 24%
General cropping down 17%
Pigs down 46%

attributes.action: To stop fining and criminalising people that are homeless/sleeping rough.
attributes.background: Homeless people are homeless for a reason. We should provide support for them rather than fining them large amounts of money which they evidently in most cases do not have.

attributes.action: Government to confirm that the June EU referendum was non-binding and advisory.
attributes.background: The government needs to publicly confirm that the referendum was merely advisory. All that is being said is that 'the people have spoken' when well over half of the electorate did not vote to leave. The govt should not assume that those who did not vote at all are not happy with the status quo.

attributes.action: Recognise the state of Palestine now alongside Israel 100 years on from Balfour
attributes.background: Our Government should recognise a state of Palestine now giving practical effect to British Policy of two states, Palestine and Israel, to live side by side in peace and security enabling Palestinians and Israelis to fulfil their right to self-determination, 100 years from the Balfour Declaration
attributes.additional_details: Palestine is recognised by over 130 countries worldwide. The United Kingdom, a permanent member of the UN Security Council,  should now do so as a major contribution to a two state solution to this conflict. While our Government recognised Israel in 1950, it has still not recognised Palestine – despite supporting many United Nations resolutions, and European Council conclusions confirming the Palestinian right to self-determination. This is in our National interest and that of the region

attributes.action: Ban the slaughter of all animals and sale of meat and dairy in the UK
attributes.background: The farming and slaughter of animals is barbaric and cruel. The consumption of meat and dairy is unsustainable for the planet. Large areas of land and forest are being destroyed globally. Animals are sentient beings who deserve the same rights as the humans they share the Earth with.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.livescience.com/27692-deforestation.html

attributes.action: NHS pensions for Dental Nurses who work in practices with an NHS contract
attributes.background:
Dental nurses across the UK are working in practices which have NHS contracts but are not entitled to an NHS pension.
Dental nurses are assisting along side Dentists who are entitled to their NHS pension so why not the nurses?

attributes.action: Provide All Children Under 16 With A Constant Glucose Monitor/Dexcom.
attributes.background:
Type One Diabetes, is a stressful, complicated disease. It is caused by the bodies immune system attacking itself, people have this disease through no fault of their own.
4 or more injections are needed daily in order for type ones to survive. As well as constant blood tests.
attributes.additional_details:
When a child is diagnosed, it is extremely difficult for a caregiver or parent to manage their Diabeties, due to them not knowing what their blood sugar levels are and will have to do more blood tests on that child than normal. A Constant Glucose Monitor, such as the Dexcom would make the child's quality of life so much better. A parent can also have some more reassurance that their child is not suffering from hypoglycaemia or hyperglycaemia. 
Type one diabetes can kill. We need this!
